intro: Glechoma leucolaena, commonly known as white ground ivy, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its creeping growth habit, with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Glechoma leucolaena is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
